snippet: A caustic campaign in Greece is reviving fears that the country could leave the eurozone, while European officials are taking an increasingly hard line toward Athens.
abstract: European officials issue stern warnings to Greece that it cannot leave the eurozone due to concerns that Alexis Tsipras, head of leftist Greek Syriza party, seems to be narrow front-runner in elections that will determine prime minister; Tsipras has vowed to roll back austerity measures and repudiate some Greek debt, which his opponent Prime Min Antonis Samaras says will lead Greece to default and exit euro.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: A caustic campaign in Greece is reviving fears that the country could leave the eurozone, while European officials are taking an increasingly hard line toward Athens.

headline.main: Euro Countries Take Tough Line Toward Greece
headline.print_headline: Euro Countries Take Tough Line Toward Greece
